meanings.definition: Presumably: used to convey that something is assumed to be the case
meanings.sent1: Presumingly, she will arrive at the party on time.
meanings.sent2: He presumingly left his keys on the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent3: The cat, presumingly, thought the vacuum cleaner was a monster.
meanings.sent4: The sun, presumingly, sets in the west every evening.
meanings.sent5: Presumingly, the treasure is buried somewhere in the old garden.

meanings.definition: Presumably: in a way that is likely or expected to be true
meanings.sent1: Presumingly, the bus will arrive at the stop in ten minutes.
meanings.sent2: She presumingly packed an umbrella in her bag for the rainy day.
meanings.sent3: The children, presumingly, finished all the cookies before dinner.
meanings.sent4: The stars, presumingly, twinkle brightly in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: Presumingly, the answer to the riddle is hidden in the last paragraph.
